body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install --verbose hypre@2.15.1~debug~int64+internal-superlu+mpi+shared arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64 %intel@18.0.1
==> mvapich2@2.2 : externally installed in /usr/tce/packages/mvapich2/mvapich2-2.2-intel-18.0.1
==> mvapich2@2.2 : already registered in DB
==> netlib-lapack@3.4.2 : externally installed in /usr
==> netlib-lapack@3.4.2 : already registered in DB
==> Installing hypre
==> Searching for binary cache of hypre
==> Warning: No Spack mirrors are currently configured
==> No binary for hypre found: installing from source
==> Fetching https://github.com/LLNL/hypre/archive/v2.15.1.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /collab/usr/gapps/librom/spack/var/spack/stage/hypre-2.15.1-hiw5j4tljni4mrb3uxmikvhhjvxgmbgj/v2.15.1.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /collab/usr/gapps/librom/spack/var/spack/stage/hypre-2.15.1-hiw5j4tljni4mrb3uxmikvhhjvxgmbgj
==> No patches needed for hypre
==> Building hypre [Package]
## Hangs here, no progress after 30+ minutes, which should not be the case
```

### Platform and user environment

OS & machine information:

```console
$ uname -a
Linux rztopaz572 3.10.0-862.14.4.1chaos.ch6.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Sep 26 12:27:08 PDT 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux 
$ lsb_release -d
Description:    Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.5 (Maipo)
``` 

Relevant configuration files:

- `${SPACK_ROOT}/etc/spack/packages.yaml`:
```yaml
packages:
  all:
    compiler: [intel@18.0.1]
    providers:
      mpi: [mvapich2]
      blas: [netlib-lapack]
      lapack: [netlib-lapack]
  mvapich2:
    paths:
      mvapich2@2.2 %intel@18.0.1: /usr/tce/packages/mvapich2/mvapich2-2.2-intel-18.0.1
  netlib-lapack:
    paths:
      netlib-lapack@3.4.2 arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64: /usr/
```

- `~/.spack/compilers.yaml`
```yaml
compilers:
- compiler:
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
    flags: {}
    modules: []
    operating_system: rhel7
    paths:
      cc: /usr/tce/packages/intel/intel-18.0.1/bin/icc
      cxx: /usr/tce/packages/intel/intel-18.0.1/bin/icpc
      f77: /usr/tce/packages/intel/intel-18.0.1/bin/ifort
      fc: /usr/tce/packages/intel/intel-18.0.1/bin/ifort
    spec: intel@18.0.1
    target: x86_64
```

### Additional information

Install status:

```console
$ spack spec --install-status hypre@2.15.1~debug~int64+internal-superlu+mpi+shared arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64 %intel@18.0.1
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   hypre~debug~int64+internal-superlu+mpi+shared arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64

Concretized
--------------------------------
 -   hypre@2.15.1%intel@18.0.1~debug~int64+internal-superlu+mpi+shared arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
[+]      ^mvapich2@2.2%intel@18.0.1~alloca ch3_rank_bits=32 ~cuda~debug fabrics=psm file_systems=auto process_managers=auto +regcache threads=multiple arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
[+]      ^netlib-lapack@3.4.2%intel@18.0.1 build_type=RelWithDebInfo ~external-blas+lapacke+shared~xblas arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64
```

Log files aren't generated by` configure`, as far as I can tell (maybe I'm looking in the wrong places?):

```console
$ find $(spack location -s hypre@2.15.1~debug~int64+internal-superlu+mpi+shared arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64 %intel@18.0.1) -name config.log
## Returns nothing.
$ find $(spack location -s hypre@2.15.1~debug~int64+internal-superlu+mpi+shared arch=linux-rhel7-x86_64 %intel@18.0.1) -name configure.log
## Returns nothing.
```
title: Installation issue: hypre installation hangs during build step
